episodes.title: Animals
episodes.plot: A mix of surprising celebrity interviews and startling sketches. The first half of the episode delves into the world of animal fetishes, with helpful contributions from Paul Daniels and Carla Lane. The second half focuses on Karla the elephant, who has unfortunately trapped her trunk up her anus.

episodes.title: Drugs
episodes.plot: What can we do about the millions of new drugs like Yellow Bentines and Triple-Sod? Award-winning Chris Morris takes another issue of the day and gives it a good spanking.

episodes.title: Science
episodes.plot: Chris Morris shakes his head in despair as more hoodwinked celebs pass on their fairly loose grasp of bizarre science stories and experiments.

episodes.title: Sex
episodes.plot: Chris Morris casts a satirical eye over the subject of sex and its relationship to society. Helpful contributors include Peter Stringfellow and David Sullivan.

episodes.title: Crime
episodes.plot: Chris Morris turns his laser eye to the subject of crime. Highlights include shocking revelations of how elephants are being used to disperse rioters, and Vanessa Feltz's message to murderers.

episodes.title: Decline
episodes.plot: Religion falls under the spotlight in this episode, which features Terry Waite discussing how Britain has been poisoned by the gospel.
